title: Source: Bills, DE J. Bosa agree on 1 year, $12.6M
content: The Bills and five-time Pro Bowl defensive end Joey Bosa have reached agreement on a one-year deal worth $12.6 million, a source told ESPN.

title: USWNT's Rodman: Matter of time to play abroad
content: United States and Washington Spirit forward Trinity Rodman has said it's a matter of time before she plays abroad but added that she remains focused on the upcoming NWSL season that kicks off on Friday.

title: Source: Chiefs open up cap via Mahomes, Jones
content: The Chiefs have restructured the contracts of quarterback Patrick Mahomes and defensive tackle Chris Jones, freeing up $49.446 million in salary cap space, a source told ESPN.

title: Sources: Ravens adding Hopkins on 1-year deal
content: DeAndre Hopkins has reached a one-year, $5 million deal that could be worth as much as $6 million with the Ravens, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Tiger has surgery for ruptured Achilles tendon
content: Tiger Woods, who hasn't competed in a PGA Tour event this season, said he had surgery to repair a ruptured left Achilles tendon and expects to make a full recovery.

title: Ex-NBA player, entrepreneur Bridgeman dies at 71
content: Junior Bridgeman, a former NBA sixth man who became a billionaire philanthropist and Bucks minority owner, has died at the age of 71.

title: Floyd signs with Falcons after exit from 49ers
content: The Falcons signed defensive end Leonard Floyd, who was released by the San Francisco 49ers on Tuesday.

title: Gonzaga wins WCC tourney title, 20th under Few
content: Gonzaga avenged two regular-season losses to Saint Mary's, defeating the 19th-ranked Gaels 58-51 in the West Coast Conference Tournament championship on Tuesday night, the 22nd league tourney title for the Bulldogs, including 20 under coach Mark Few.

title: Men's Bracketology: Gonzaga rises with big day for bubble teams on tap
content: The Zags improved their seeding in our projected field of 68 after clinching the WCC tournament title.

title: Tracking NFL free agency: Live updates on every signing, trade, cut and rumor
content: Free agency has kicked off with the legal negotiation window and there has already been plenty of action.

title: How the SEC became the most dominant conference in college basketball
content: Dwarfed by football no more, the SEC's rise as a men's basketball powerhouse didn't happen overnight.

title: What happens in Vegas: Oregon State punches ticket, UNLV upset to shake up women's Bracketology
content: Champ Week claimed another conference tournament 1-seed when UNLV was upset. But Oregon State's unlikely path to March Madness won the day.

title: From a South Carolina repeat to UConn ending its title drought: Six teams that could win it all
content: Sixty-eight teams will compete in  March Madness. But these six make up the short list of title contenders.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Injury outlook for all 30 teams
content: Our NBA insiders analyze this week's Power Rankings and assess the health status of all 30 teams with one month remaining in the regular season.

title: How Jacob deGrom is learning to throw smarter, not harder
content: DeGrom hasn't pitched a full season since 2019 -- but the Rangers ace has a plan to make 2025 special.

title: Why astronaut Suni Williams runs in space: a 14-billion-year odyssey
content: Suni Williams' eight-day mission turned into a nine-month marathon. Now the astronaut is days away from leaving the International Space Station and returning to Earth.

title: NHL playoff projections: Canucks or Flames for the final Western Conference wild card?
content: The two Pacific Division clubs vying for one spot face off Wednesday night in Alberta. Plus, updated playoff projections, draft lottery outlook, more.

title: Awards Watch: New leaders for Hart, Norris as playoff races heat up
content: With about a month left in the regular season, there are new leaders for league MVP and the best defenseman.

title: How PSG's midfield and the new Champions League format ousted Liverpool
content: Liverpool's tense exit from the Champions League was a game to forget for Darwin Núñez. Meanwhile, PSG's Ousmane Dembélé and Gianluigi Donnarumma silenced their critics en route to the quarterfinals.

title: Man Utd CEO: New stadium poses 'risk' to team
content: Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada has admitted the club "risk" falling further behind their rivals while they invest in their new stadium.

title: Atleti's Correa gets 5-match ban for ref insults
content: Atlético Madrid forward Ángel Correa has been handed a five-game ban for insulting the referee after being sent off in the club's 2-1 defeat at Getafe on Sunday.

title: Slot: Loss to PSG 'best game' I've been part of
content: Liverpool head coach Arne Slot described the second leg of his team's Champions League tie with Paris Saint-Germain as the "best game of football" he has been involved in.

title: Alexander-Arnold a doubt for Carabao Cup final
content: Liverpool defender Trent Alexander-Arnold is a doubt for the League Cup final after sustaining an injury in Tuesday's Champions League loss to PSG.

title: Son of ex-Brazil star Marcelo gets Spain U17 call
content: Enzo Alves, son of former Real Madrid and Brazil left back Marcelo, was called up for Spain's under-17 national team on Tuesday.

title: PSV to compensate fans at Arsenal tie after 7-1
content: PSV have announced that they will compensate their fans attending the second leg of their round of 16 Champions League tie at Arsenal on Wednesday.

title: Bayern coach Kompany says Kane 'better with age'
content: Bayern Munich striker Harry Kane earned praise from coach Vincent Kompany on Tuesday after scoring one goal and setting up another in a 2-0 victory at Bayer Leverkusen that saw them book their Champions League quarter-final spot.

title: Labor union says FIFA blocked Azteca inspection
content: An international federation of labor unions said on Tuesday that FIFA denied it access to the Azteca Stadium to inspect conditions of construction workers doing renovations ahead of the 2026 World Cup.

title: Can anyone stop Scottie Scheffler? Who are some sleeper picks? Previewing the Players storylines
content: From Scheffler's attempt at a three-peat to Colin Morikawa's chances to get back in the winner's circle, we have five big topics to keep an eye on this week.

title: 'He's got it': An oral history of the NBA's COVID-19 shutdown -- and how it changed sports forever
content: On the fifth anniversary of the night the NBA shut down, ESPN reveals how it happened, down to the minute -- told by the players, executives, politicians, doctors and journalists who were there.

title: MMA divisional rankings: How far does Alex Pereira fall at light heavyweight?
content: Here's a look at every weight class to determine the best of the best in UFC, Bellator, PFL and beyond.

title: Juan Soto first OF pick in last mock before Opening Day
content: Check out the results of our first fantasy baseball head-to-head points mock draft of 2025, featuring round-by-round picks and a snapshot of the rosters of all 10 teams.

title: Waiver wire pickups: Look to Naji Marshall, Stephon Castle
content: The waiver wire always has players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add this week.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal eye Bayern winger Leroy Sané
content: Arsenal are considering a move to sign Bayern Munich winger Leroy Sané. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Man United's new stadium will be big, but it won't be world's biggest football ground
content: Manchester United's proposed new 100,000-seat home will be one of the world's largest soccer stadiums, but it won't be the biggest.

title: Ferrari's debut winners: Can Lewis Hamilton join list of legends?
content: Some of the biggest names in F1 history have won in their debuts with Ferrari, a feat Lewis Hamilton will look to replicate on Sunday in Australia.

title: Gold, lies & a grisly murder: Inspired by 'Drishya', man kills woman, dumps body in garbage
content: A Bengaluru electrician, Lakshman, has been arrested for murdering a 50-year-old woman, D Mary, to rob her gold ornaments worth Rs 4 lakh. Inspired by a Kannada movie to destroy evidence, he disposed of her body in a dumpyard. Police tracked him through call records, leading to his confession and recovery of the skeletal remains.

title: 'Hasina coming back as PM': Why Awami League leader thanked India
content: Senior Awami League leader Rabbi Alam has claimed that Sheikh Hasina will return as the prime minister of Bangladesh. He thanked India for providing a safe haven for Hasina, who fled last year after violent clashes. Mohammed Yunus led the interim government and sought Hasina's extradition, which India hasn't officially responded to yet.

title: After 300 yrs, Dalit families enter Gidheshwar Shiv Temple in Bengal
content: Dalit families in a West Bengal village have been allowed to worship at the Gidheshwar Shiv Temple for the first time in nearly 300 years, breaking a significant caste barrier. Despite initial resistance and economic boycotts, intervention by local authorities facilitated this historic event.

title: 'Entire world will wear bhagwa': UP CM says Saffron is his identity
content: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath expressed his pride in wearing saffron attire, predicting its global acceptance. He spoke on the Sambhal mosque controversy, stressing the historical significance of the Vishnu temple predating Islam and questioned opposition leaders' commitment to preserving cultural and religious heritage.

title: Ranya Rao gold case: BJP doubles down on Cong link claim, shares photo
content: BJP leader Amit Malviya shared a photo linking Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah with actress Ranya Rao, who is accused in a gold smuggling case. Malviya took a dig at Deputy CM DK Shivakumar, who had earlier denied any political connection to the case, further escalating tensions.

title: S.Korea may scrap 52-hour workweek for chip firms & 'reasons' are China, US
content: South Korea’s Industry and Labour Ministers advocated revising the 52-hour workweek to permit semiconductor researchers to work longer hours, emphasizing the necessity due to intense global competition. Despite ongoing debates, no consensus has been reached on the special bill for the semiconductor industry exemption.

title: 'Doomsday, panic everywhere': Survivors recall BLA's shock train attack
content: Survivors of the Jaffar Express attack by the Balochistan Liberation Army recounted the horror of being hijacked and enduring intense gunfire. The female and elderly were spared, while security personnel and Punjabis were targeted. Security forces rescued 190 hostages from the 450 passengers. Violence has escalated in Balochistan against non-Baloch Pakistanis, with the BLA intensifying attacks.

title: 'Only 18 of 68 sites found': CM Yogi hints at more excavations in Sambhal
content: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath urged people to stop glorifying foreign invaders, stressing the importance of preserving religious sites like Sambhal. Speaking in Lucknow, he emphasized the need to respect places of worship and criticized those who forcibly occupy them. He also highlighted the significance of the Maha Kumbh and criticized previous administrations for mismanagement.

title: Watch: How Baloch insurgents blew up tracks, hijacked Pak train
content: The Baloch Liberation Army hijacked a passenger train in Pakistan's Balochistan province, detonating an explosive to halt the train and taking passengers hostage. Pakistani security forces managed to rescue 155 passengers, while 27 militants were killed in the ensuing standoff. The situation remains critical as insurgents still hold hostages.

title: Nithin Kamath said Zerodha users drop in 15 years; Groww may just agree
content: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath revealed that the company is experiencing its first business slowdown in 15 years. A decline in active users across major stock broking platforms signifies a broader market correction. According to National Stock Exchange (NSE) data, eight of the top 10 broking firms saw a decline in active investors in February.  Kamath noted a 30% drop in trading activity due to market conditions and regulatory changes.

title: 'Always wanted to be around Mahi bhai': Samson on bond with Dhoni
content: Sanju Samson, captain of Rajasthan Royals, shares his experiences and admiration for former Indian captain MS Dhoni, while expressing enthusiasm about RR's young talent, Vaibhav Suryavanshi. Samson highlights his evolving relationship with Dhoni and praises 13-year-old Vaibhav's power-hitting abilities and potential in the IPL, boasting his impressive performance and promising future.

title: Haryana 'prof' trying to fly to UK with 7 'students' with fake papers, held
content: A professor from a Haryana university was arrested at Mumbai airport for allegedly using false information to obtain visas for seven youths to the UK under a fake student exchange programme. Police suspect it to be a case of human trafficking and have begun an investigation, with the help of a confession from the professor about his involvement.

title: Zepto vs Mohammad Arshad's Zepto: Delhi HC rules in favour of ...
content: Kiranakart, parent company of Zepto, won a trademark dispute in Delhi High Court against Mohammad Arshad, whose "Zepto" trademark from 2014 remained unused. The court ruled in favor of Kiranakart, citing Arshad's lack of genuine commercial use, allowing the removal of his trademark registration. Zepto, active in quick commerce since 2021, has built significant market presence.

title: Pune bus rape case: Accused remanded to judicial custody till March 26
content: Dattatray Gade, accused of raping a 26-year-old woman in a parked MSRTC bus at Pune's Swargate terminus, has been remanded to police custody until March 26. The arrest followed an extensive manhunt with Gade attempting suicide multiple times before being captured. Authorities are investigating security lapses at the terminus, while protests and calls for swift justice continue.

title: Ex-Pak cricketer picks Champions Trophy XI with no Pakistani players
content: Former Pakistan cricketer Basit Ali has revealed his ICC Champions Trophy playing XI, with India's Rohit Sharma as captain. His team focuses on performances in Dubai and differs from the official ICC team. Ali highlighted key performances, especially Sharma's 76 in the final, and included other top players like Virat Kohli and Shreyas Iyer.

title: PM Modi receives Mauritius' highest award; 8 pacts signed
content: During his visit to Mauritius, Prime Minister Narendra Modi was honored with the nation's highest award, dedicating it to the Indian ancestors of Mauritius and all generations. Modi emphasized his commitment to strengthening the India-Mauritius partnership and jointly inaugurated the Atal Bihari Vajpayee Institute of Public Service and Innovation.

title: Retail CPI inflation eases to 7-month low of 3.61% in Feb; Jan IIP growth at 5%
content: Retail inflation in February dropped to a 7-month low of 3.61%. It remains within the RBI's target. Food inflation also saw significant reductions in both rural and urban areas. This decline may encourage the Monetary Policy Committee to cut the repo rate in April to boost GDP growth.

title: World No.1 Shubman Gill crowned ICC Player of the Month
content: Shubman Gill has been named the ICC Men’s Player of the Month for February 2025 after impressive ODI performances, amassing 406 runs in five matches. His stellar displays, including a century against England and a crucial knock in the Champions Trophy, have solidified his position as the world’s top ODI batter.

title: 'India imposes 150% tariff on American alcohol': White House
content: The White House criticized tariffs imposed on US products by India and Canada, highlighting significant tariffs on American alcohol and agricultural goods by India. President Trump advocates for fair trade, hinting at potential tariff increases to counteract what he views as unfair international trade practices.

title: Musk to Bezos, billionaires who attended Trump’s inauguration face $209 billion loss
content: Following the inauguration of Donald Trump, financial setbacks have plagued five major billionaires, with a combined loss of $209 billion. Tesla’s Elon Musk has seen his wealth plummet by $148 billion, while Jeff Bezos and Sergey Brin also face substantial declines. Market uncertainties and government policies are factors impacting their fortunes.

title: 'Need 5-6 more trophies': Hardik after winning CT & T20 WC in a short span
content: Hardik Pandya lifted the ICC Champions Trophy in 2025, eight years after his valiant 76-run knock in the 2017 final against Pakistan ended in defeat. Pandya expressed joy and determination, eager for more titles. Celebrating the team’s effort, he aims for India to win the 2026 ICC T20 World Cup on home soil.

title: Watch: Thar driver goes on rampage in Noida, hits vehicles after tiff over speakers
content: A man driving a Thar caused havoc in Noida when he fled recklessly after an argument about installing speakers. The viral video shows the Thar hitting several vehicles without slowing down. Police have registered a complaint and formed teams to apprehend the driver.

title: Razor blade found in mess curry, Osmania University hostel launch stir
content: Students at Osmania University protested after allegedly finding a razor blade in a curry served at their hostel mess. They demanded an immediate response from the Vice Chancellor. In response, university authorities set up a committee to investigate the incident.

title: Watch: Rajasthan man descends into 120-feet well to rescue stranded cat
content: In Jhunjhunu's Soti village, a young man named Ankit Kumar bravely descended into a 120-foot-deep dry well to rescue a cat trapped for five days. Despite the well's damage and the cat's initial resistance, Ankit's persistent efforts successfully saved the feline. The cat, though shaken, ultimately dashed to safety, thanks to the commendable rescue mission.

title: 'I believe Lando Norris is ready': Mika Hakkinen on McLaren driver
content: Several F1 experts have tagged McLaren as the favorite for the upcoming season, with Mika Hakkinen endorsing Lando Norris as a potential world champion. Both Norris and teammate Oscar Piastri aim to impress, leveraging McLaren's superior MCL39 supercar.

title: Rohit rises to no. 3 in ODI rankings after CT final heroics
content: India won the ICC Men’s Champions Trophy 2025 by defeating New Zealand in the final. The victory led to several Indian and New Zealand players climbing up the ICC Men’s ODI Player Rankings. Shubman Gill and Rohit Sharma made notable gains among batters, while Mitchell Santner and Kuldeep Yadav rose in the bowling rankings.

title: Post Ranveer Allahbadia controversy, does OTT content also need regulations?
content: Ranveer Allahbadia's controversial question on parental sex in a show has sparked a debate on the need for censorship in OTT platforms. Industry experts suggest that self-regulation and parental guidance might be better approaches than strict censorship. The key is finding a balance between creative freedom and content moderation to protect vulnerable audiences.

title: BBA student made to run 500m, hunted down and shot dead in UP
content: A 19-year-old college student, Amogh Seth, was fatally shot in Lakhimpur Kheri after being chased and attacked by six men, including the main suspect, Anmol Puri. The incident occurred near a police outpost. Amogh had earlier insulted Anmol, leading to the latter seeking revenge. Two suspects have been detained while Anmol remains at large.

title: The good and not so good about Sunil Chhetri's comeback
content: Sunil Chhetri's return to the national team has sparked a mix of hope and questions among Indian football fans. Despite his age, his leadership is seen as a potential boost for the team. The article examines the challenges faced by Indian football in finding a successor and the broader need for structural development.

title: 'Woman of terrorist mentality': BJP MLA on Darbhanga mayor over Holi request
content: BJP MLA Haribhushan Thakur criticized Darbhanga mayor Anjum Ara for her Holi advisory, calling it a display of 'terrorist mentality'. Ara requested a two-hour break in Holi festivities to coincide with Friday prayers during Ramzan. Thakur insists Holi celebrations will proceed uninterrupted, warning of strict actions against any disruptions.

title: Greenland polls: Opposition party Democrats wins amid Trump's 'acquire' threat
content: Greenland’s centre-right opposition, the Democrats, emerged victorious with 29.9% votes, while the nationalist Naleraq party followed closely.

title: Indian-origin student disappears: 24-year old named 'person of interest'
content: Authorities in Virginia have identified 24-year-old Joshua Ribe as a person of interest in the disappearance of University of Pittsburgh student Sudiksha Konanki in the Dominican Republic. Konanki vanished during a spring break trip, and Ribe has given conflicting accounts of the night’s events. The FBI and local authorities are intensifying their search efforts.

title: Mosques covered ahead of Laat Sahab Holi in UP's Shahjahanpur
content: Shahjahanpur is preparing for ‘Laat Sahab’ Holi on March 14 with extensive security measures. Around 3,500 security personnel, drones, and CCTV cameras will ensure safety. Authorities emphasize cooperation for a peaceful celebration.

title: Pahlaj Nihalani breaks silence on Govinda’s shocking 'sabotage' claims
content: Pahlaj Nihalani addresses Govinda's claims of career sabotage in Bollywood. Nihalani explains the challenges faced, specifically with 'Rangila Raja,' and discusses rumors about James Cameron's 'Avatar.' He emphasizes Govinda's talent and fan base but mentions the need for better advisors. He also reflects on past projects and industry hesitancies.

title: 'Stop twisting facts': DMK counters Centre's 'consent' claim amid three-language showdown
content: DMK MP Kanimozhi accused Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan of misrepresenting Tamil Nadu's stance on PM-SHRI schools, clarifying they never agreed to the three-language policy or NEP fully. This follows Pradhan's claim of TN staging the language controversy to gain political points. Union Minister Nirmala Sitharaman also weighed in, criticizing the DMK's perceived hypocrisy.

title: Energy-boosting pills made in Uttarakhand send 9 to hospital in Singapore
content: Nine people in Singapore have been hospitalized after consuming unregistered Armodafinil tablets from India, resulting in severe skin conditions. The drug, manufactured by HAB Pharmaceuticals in Dehradun's Selaqui area, was procured from street peddlers. The Health Sciences Authority has cautioned against its use, highlighting cases of Stevens-Johnson Syndrome and other serious complications.

title: 'Poisoned son, throttled daughter': Ex-lecturer, wife kill kids, before suicide
content: Chandrasekhar Reddy, a former lecturer, and his wife reportedly killed their two children before taking their own lives due to financial struggles. Police recovered a suicide note detailing their hardships. The family, originally from Wanaparthy, had recently moved to Hyderabad. Investigations are ongoing, and a case has been registered.

title: Pak train hijack: BLA issues 48-hour ultimatum, threatens to execute more hostages
content: In Pakistan's Balochistan province, armed militants hijacked a passenger train, killing three people and taking over 450 hostages. Security forces responded swiftly, rescuing more than 150 passengers and killing 27 militants. The Baloch Liberation Army claimed responsibility for the attack, which unfolded as militants targeted the train by blowing up the railway track.

title: Kunickaa opens up about Akshay's affairs and fitness: 'Testosterones are active...'
content: Kunickaa Sadanand reflects on her past relationship with Kumar Sanu and comments on Akshay Kumar's fitness. She emphasizes how high testosterone levels contribute to fitness. Kunickaa also highlights the challenges faced by women in the film industry, detailing her experiences with inappropriate advances and the support from her hairdresser.

title: Allahabad HC allows whitewashing, lighting of Sambhal Jama Masjid exterior
content: The Allahabad High Court allows whitewashing and decorative lighting of Sambhal Jama Masjid’s exterior, with no structural changes. ASI is tasked with inspecting the site and reporting the necessity of these changes. The court has scheduled the next hearing for April 8.

title: Meghalaya city tops global air pollution list; India No. 5
content: India was the fifth most polluted country globally in 2024, with Byrnihat in Meghalaya being the most polluted metropolitan area. Despite a 7% decline in PM2.5 concentrations compared to 2023, major urban centers like New Delhi continued to face severe air pollution problems.

title: 'Muslims part of Shivaji's army': Ajit Pawar advises restrain after Rane's comments
content: Deputy CM Ajit Pawar urged political leaders to exercise caution in their statements after Fisheries Minister Nitesh Rane claimed Muslims were not in Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's army. Pawar emphasized that historical research confirms Muslim participation in Shivaji Maharaj’s forces, noting their patriotic contributions.

title: $1 trillion wiped out! Indian stock market crash shrinks share in global cap
content: The Indian stock market has seen a dramatic fall, with BSE Sensex and Nifty50 losing over $1 trillion in market value in four months, driven by domestic economic challenges. Despite this downturn, Morgan Stanley predicts the Sensex to reach 105,000 points by December 2025, citing India's stable earnings growth.

title: Myanmar refugees threatening security, draining resources: Mizoram activist to Amit Shah
content: More than 30,000 refugees — mostly Chins ethnically related to the majority Mizos of Mizoram — are said to be taking shelter in the northeastern State

title: Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly Speaker asks 23 NDA MLAs to ‘break the silence’
content: Observing that they have not spoken at all in the ongoing Budget session, Ayyanna Patrudu advises them to actively participate, keeping in view the mandate given to them by their constituents

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Construction of Nedumbrakkad-Vilakkumaram bridge completed
content: The bridge, constructed over the Vayalarkayal, would be opened for traffic soon after the completion of the approach roads

title: Display of menu, rate list of food items in trains mandatory: Railway Minister
content: Menu of all food items along with rates are available on IRCTC's website for information of passengers. Printed menu cards with all details are made available with waiters and presented to passengers on demand, says

title: Forcible transfer of Kakinada Seaports shares: Vijaya Sai points the finger of blame at Y.V. Subba Reddy’s son Vikranth Reddy
content: It was Vikranth Reddy who brokered the entire deal, the former MP tells CID, while insisting that former Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy was neither a party to the transaction nor benefited from it

title: Assam to build shelter home for transgender people
content: The initiative underscores the government’s efforts to foster inclusivity, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said

title: Ministry of Defence signs ₹2,906 crore radar contract with BEL for the Indian Air Force
content: Low-level Transportable Radar, LLTR (Ashwini) is an active electronically scanned phased array radar based on state-of-the-art solid state technology, the Ministry said

title: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah extends support to T.N. CM Stalin’s effort to oppose delimitation
content: Any effort by the Centre that hurts the interest of Karnataka or undermine the philosophy of federalism enshrined in the constitution will be condemned, Siddaramaiah said

title: ₹4.21 lakh crore Madhya Pradesh budget focused on industrial growth
content: 1.27 crore beneficiaries of the Ladli Behna scheme, will be linked with the Central government’s schemes, including the Atal Pension Yojana, the Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana, and the PM Suraksha Bima Yojana, Deputy CM and Finance Minister Jagdish Devda said

title: Solapur handloom industry struggles between lack of recognition and finding buyers
content: The weavers have been demanding the inclusion of their product, the ‘Solapuri silk saree’, in the list of traditional textiles under the Maharashtra government’s textile policy of 2023

title: 224 species documented in Mysuru belt in 2025 annual bird census
content: Out of 110 locations across which the birds were surveyed, the most abundant species in any one location was the Bar-headed Goose.

title: Delhi High Court issues notice to NIA on MP Engineer Rashid's plea seeking permission to attend Parliament
content: “Issue notice. Let objections, if any, be placed before this court on Monday,” the Bench said while posting the hearing on March 18

title: Worried about repaying loans, woman ends life in Alur
content: According to her family members, she was worried about repaying the loans taken from a microfinance company and from relatives

title: Retail inflation eases to a seven month low of 3.61% in February
content: The easing annual change in general price level comes on a slump in Consumer Food Price Inflation to 3.75% in February 2025

title: Self-styled godman held for abetment to suicide in Jalna
content: The godman reportedly pressured the victim to hand over his five-year-old daughter for an occult ritual

title: Onion auctions resume at Mumbai’s Lasalgaon market after farmers’ protest over price drop
content: The farmers were demanding the removal of the 20% export duty on onions, which they claim has led to a sharp decline in prices

title: Daily Quiz: On India’s ICC wins
content: India defeated New Zealand by four wickets to win the 2025 Champions Trophy in Dubai, adding a seventh ICC trophy to their cabinet while registering their third win in this eight-team event. Here is a quiz on all the times India have won an ICC trophy

title: After spat with Nitish, Rabri Devi alleges CM Nitish 'high on cannabis'
content: Trouble began when Shashi Yadav, an MLC of the CPI(ML), an RJD ally, rose in her chair to submit before the House that she was not satisfied with the government's reply to her question

title: Friday prayers after 2 p.m. to accommodate Holi in Ayodhya, says chief cleric
content: Ayodhya's District Magistrate (DM), Chandra Vijay Singh, said police personnel have been stationed at all Holika Dahan sites to maintain order.

title: Mauritius visit: PM Modi announces India’s ‘Mahasagar’ vision for Global South
content: Eight agreements were firmed up between the two sides providing for cooperation in an array of areas including maritime security, trade in national currencies and capacity building

title: If T.N. State Board is successful, why are children of DMK leaders studying in private schools: Annamalai
content: In Matriculation schools run by the DMK [members], Tamil is not a compulsory language but only an optional language, the BJP leader stated

title: NCLAT rejects IRDAI pleas against Shriram Group’s insurance arms merger proposals
content: NCLAT rejects IRDAI pleas against Shriram Group insurance arm mergers, citing no statutory bar under Insurance Act.

title: Police visit homestays and resorts in Chikkamagaluru to check security measures
content: During the visits, the police personnel checked if the owners had installed CCTV cameras and employed sufficient staff for the security of the guests, among other things

title: FIR lodged in connection with 'Azad Kashmir' graffiti on Jadavpur University campus
content: "A suo motu case has been filed at Jadavpur Police station under Sections 61(2) and 152 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita," a senior officer said

title: No group rides, no throwing colours on unwilling people: Hyderabad police issue orders ahead of Holi 2025
content: The order, issued by Hyderabad Police Commissioner C.V. Anand, will be in force from 6 p.m. on March 13 to 6 a.m. on March 15

title: Sambhal mentioned in scriptures that predate Islam, temple was destroyed in 1526: U.P. CM Yogi Adityanath
content: Evidence for these things has existed for centuries. In 1526, a temple of Lord Vishnu in Sambhal was demolished. Two years later, the Ram temple in Ayodhya was destroyed,’ said the Chief Minister

title: ‘I know 7-8 languages,’ says Rajya Sabha MP Sudha Murthy in support of three-language policy
content: Her comments come amid a tussle between Tamil Nadu and the Central government over the three-language formula in schools under the NEP 2020

title: RJD MP Jha asks EC to immediately take call on extent of duplicate voter ID card numbers
content: Stressing that the duplicate voter ID card number issue is a matter of concern, the RJD member said the Article 324 of the Constitution enshrines free and fair elections as well as the level-playing field

title: Former V-C of Bharathiar University, 15 others booked for wrongful loss of ₹8.01 lakh in purchase of 61 computers
content: The case was registered against the accused by the DVAC on February 20, 2025, on charges of colluding and causing the loss

title: ‘Eating halal not written in Hindu religion,’ says Nitesh Rane on Malhar certification issue
content: Mr. Rane appealed to the people to use the certification and not buy mutton from places where the certification was not available.

title: It’s State responsibility to stop all kinds of illegal coal mining: Centre
content: Asked about the recent accident and loss of lives at a coal mine in Assam, Union Coal Minister Kishan Reddy said he has spoken to Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma

title: Watch: Priyadarshi discusses ‘Court’ and how cinema is only a part of his life
content: Actor Priyadarshi on his Telugu film, ‘Court’, and how he straddles comic characters and plays the leading man in offbeat films

title: Why force change when T.N.’s education is producing top thinkers: Anbil Mahesh asks Pradhan
content: He was replying to a post of Mr. Pradhan quoting the UDISE+ data showing a dip enrolment in Tamil-medium schools.

title: Probe ordered into alleged insult of PDO in Belagavi district
content: The police social media cell officers flagged down a video of a youth using bad language against Nagendra Pattar, a panchayat development officer (PDO) in Kinaye village on March 12

title: Case registered against 8 CPI(M) workers for attack on BJP activist in Kerala’s Kannur
content: According to the FIR, the attack was politically motivated, with the accused allegedly attempting to the kill BJP worker

title: Parts of Tamil Nadu witness another day of scattered rainfall; dry weather to return on March 13
content: Thiyagadurgam in Kallakurichi district received 16 cm, which was the heaviest rainfall in the State during the past 24 hours (as of 8.30 a.m.) on March 12. The maximum temperature had dipped below average by three to six degree Celsius at a few places

title: DMK names C.V.M.P. Ezhilarasan as propaganda secretary
content: Mr. Ezhilarasan has been relieved from his current post of students’ wing secretary, DMK general secretary Duraimurugan said in a statement

title: Haryana civic polls: BJP wins 7 out of 10 Mayor posts, leads in two
content: Registering a convincing win in the Hoodas’ bastion, BJP’s Ram Avtar defeated Congress’ Surjamal Kiloi with a margin of over 45,000 votes in the Mayor’s election to the Rohtak municipal corporation

title: Thiruvananthapuram Corporation makes elaborate arrangements for Attukal Pongala
content: While waste management after the festival is the civic body’s major focus, it has also readied other facilities, including maintenance work on roads in festival area

title: Kerala Government blames Koodalmanikyam Devaswom Board administrator, tantric collective for discriminating against backward-class employee
content: Replying to a submission, Minister V.N. Vasavan says administrator acted out of line with law after temple’s tantric collective objected to B. Balu’s presence in the temple precincts as Kazhakam employee, citing his caste origins

title: High Court directs ASI to complete whitewashing of Jama Masjid in Sambhal within one week
content: Allahabad hc Justice Rohit Ranjan Agarwal also directed the Archeological Survey of India to install lights on the outer portion of the mosque.

title: BC reservation Bill, SCs sub-categorisation, Future City outlined by Telangana Governor at commencement of budget session
content: Telangana at cusp of transformative era driven by inclusive growth and sustainable leadership, he said

title: Law Ministry asks Gujarat court to serve Adani in U.S. SEC suit
content: The Union law ministry acknowledged the US Securities and Exchange Commission’s request for assistance in its lawsuit against Adani, and asked an Ahmedabad sessions court to serve Adani Group chairman Gautam Adani.

title: M.P. police shave heads of nine youths in Dewas, parade them on streets for misbehaviour during Champions Trophy celebrations
content: After India beat New Zealand, incidents of clashes and vandalism were reported in parts of Dewas. In one such incident, some youth allegedly misbehaved with the Kotwali police station in-charge during a confrontation over bursting of firecrackers.

title: PM in Mauritius Day 2 LIVE updates: Our vision for Global South will be MAHASAGAR: PM Modi
content: “Our vision focusses on trade for development, capacity building for sustainable growth, and mutual security for a shared future,” Prime Minister Narendra Modi said.

title: T.N. govt. letter made no mention of accepting three-language policy or NEP: Kanimozhi
content: She was responding to Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan, who had shared a letter from the T.N. government regarding its intent to sign an MoU to implement the PM SHRI scheme

title: Baloch Rebels Release Video Of How They Blew Up Train Tracks, Took Hostages
content: A rebel group in Pakistan's south-western Balochistan bombed a section of the railway track and stormed a train on Tuesday afternoon in the mountainous southwest, shows a video released by the Baloch Liberation Army.

title: "8 Urns With Bones, Hair": A 'Black Magic' Twist In Lilavati Hospital Fraud
content: The trustees of Mumbai's Lilavati Hospital have made shocking allegations of black magic as the premier healthcare facility made headlines due to a huge misappropriation of funds

title: "Did Women Roam Naked Before 2005?" Rabri Devi Counters Nitish Kumar's Jabs
content: With the political temperature in Bihar rising in the election year, Chief Minister Nitish Kumar and Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Rabri Devi exchanged sharp barbs in the Legislative Council.

title: BJP Sweeps Haryana Local Polls, Wins 9 Of 10, Congress Loses In Hooda Bastion
content: Counting for municipal body polls in Haryana show the ruling BJP is leading in, or has already won, the mayoral seat for nine of 10 civic bodies, including the high-profile Gurugram post.

title: How Will Elon Musk's Starlink Help Indian Internet Users? Expert Says This
content: Elon Musk's SpaceX will soon offer Starlink's satellite internet service to its customers in India. Bharti Airtel and Jio have signed a deal with Mr Musk's company to launch mass satellite broadband services.

title: IndusInd Bank's Damage Control After Rs 2,100 Crore Accounting Lapse
content: IndusInd Bank on Tuesday addressed the fallout of a Rs 2,100 crore discrepancy in accounting, saying it has enough reserves and capital to cover for it.

title: 10 Sambhal Mosques To Be Covered With Tarpaulin During Holi
content: The Uttar Pradesh (UP) administration has decided to cover ten mosques in Sambhal during Holi celebrations on Friday. March 14 marks a rare sixty-year coincidence of the festival of colours and a Ramazan 'Jumma' falling together on the same day.

title: Madhya Pradesh's Education Paradox? More Money, Fewer Students
content: The Madhya Pradesh budget was presented on Wednesday and the allocation for education got a boost, with a hike of 4% and now representing 11.26% of the total budget.

title: "Get In, Patriots": Donald Trump Buys Tesla, Elon Musk Helps Him Pick
content: Donald Trump bought the Tesla in a show of support for Elon Musk's electric vehicle company, which is facing a blowback because of the Tesla CEO's work to advance the President's political agenda.

title: Scientists Find 4 Tiny Planets Orbiting Earth's Nearest Star
content: Astronomers have revealed new evidence that there are not just one but four tiny planets circling around Barnard's Star, the second-nearest star system to Earth.

title: Dravid Missing From RR Camp For IPL 2025 After Suffering Injury During...
content: Rajasthan Royals head coach Rahul Dravid was missing from their pre-season training camp ahead of the IPL 2025 due to injury.

title: Telangana Man Kills Wife After She Refuses To Cook Mutton Curry
content: A furious husband brutally beat his wife to death after she allegedly refused to cook mutton curry for him in Telangana'sMahabubabad on Wednesday.

title: Man Shares Video Of Rats Crawling In Train's AC Coach, Railways Reacts
content: A train passenger recently took to social media to share multiple videos of rats crawling in an AC coach of the South Bihar Express.

title: Watch: Last Footage Of Indian Student Who Went Missing In Dominican Republic
content: Sudiksha Konanki, the Indian student who went missing from the Dominican Republic, was last seen walking with friends hours before she mysteriously vanished from a beach on the Caribbean island.

title: NDTV Explains New Bill That Can Deny Foreigners Visas Over 'National Security'
content: Foreigners can be denied visas on national security grounds, their movements can be restricted, and they can be penalised for violating rules governing entry into, and exit from, India, according to a proposed law tabled by Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Hunted Down, Massacred, Syria's Alawites Ask India For Help
content: Ali Koshmr, a 36-year-old man from Syria's Latakia, around 330 km from Damascus, woke up to the sounds of gunfire, tires screeching and dozens of armed men shouting, "Come out, you Alawite pigs, Nusayris!"

title: Nirmala Sitharaman attends breakfast meeting with Kerala CM, Governor at Kerala House in Delhi
content: Nirmala Sitharaman’s visit follows Governor’s promise to Pinarayi Vijayan that the former would champion Kerala’s issues with the Centre

title: Hydraulic sludge robot deployed to cut stones, move through debris in Telangana SLBC tunnel on 19th day of rescue work
content: SCCL procured timber from its store and the third cognac was constructed yesterday towards the end of the tunnel to ensure safety against any blocks falling from the top, sources said

title: Five students of school at Kalamassery in Kerala show symptoms of viral meningitis
content: Condition of children remains stable. Samples sent to National Institute of Virology, Alappuzha, for testing

title: Markets turn flat after rallying in early trade amid volatile trends
content: The 30-share BSE Sensex jumped 289.83 points or 0.39% to 74,392.15 in the morning trade. On the similar lines, the Nifty went up 79.5 points or 0.35% to 22,577.40

title: Remand prisoner Borugadda Anil Kumar surrenders before Rajahmundry Central Prison day after expiry of interim bail
content: Mr. Anil Kumar did not surrender before the prison authorities on March 11 as directed by the High Court of Andhra Pradesh; The Prison Superintendent writes to the court for further action for failing to adhere to the latter’s  order.

title: BEE leads Centre’s survey on energy-efficient cooling solutions
content: Replacing outdated ACs with 5-star-rated models could improve efficiency by up to 60% and reduce overall power consumption, said BEE media advisor (South)

title: People living near river drains are at elevated risk of developing cancer: ICMR
content: Union Minister of State for Health and Family Welfare, Prataprao Jadhav stated this in a written reply in the Rajya Sabha

title: JD(S) MLC Bhoje Gowda turns Legislative Council of Karnataka into concert hall
content: When members were discussing the problems faced by adolescents, with special reference to female adolescents, the MLC broke into a Kannada song by Gururaj Hoskote describing the pain of a mother while marrying off her daughter

title: India charges 150% tariff on American alcohol: White House Press Secretary
content: “You think that’s helping Kentucky bourbon be exported into India?” asked White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt

title: Karnataka Budget session: Amended APMC Bill seeks to include e-commerce platforms
content: The term “warehouse service provider” has been inserted to bring the e-commerce platform under the ambit of APMC to collect cess

title: Delhi Police continues crackdown on ‘illegal’ Bangladeshi immigrants
content: Delhi Police had earlier arrested three “illegal” Bangladeshi immigrants from the outer district’s Peeragarhi area

title: Vice Chancellors, academicians decry attempt to prevent JU academic from entering campus
content: Professor Om Prakash Mishra, one of the senior most professors of the State run university, was prevented by a section of protesting students from entering the campus on March 10

title: U.S. Vice-President Vance likely to travel to India later this month: Report
content: J.D. Vance and Second Lady Usha Vance to visit India, marking Usha’s first trip to her ancestral country

title: File counter in drone case against Revanth Reddy: HC asks public prosecutor
content: The case was registered against Mr. Revanth Reddy when he was Malkajgiri MP and was accused of flying a drone over a farm house reportedly belonging to BRS working president and MLA K.T. Rama Rao

title: Three-time Congress MLA Jagga Reddy to set the silver screen ablaze
content: Mr. Reddy clarified that he is not going away from politics and has accepted the film that is woven around his personality just for fun

title: Jio ties up with Elon Musk’s SpaceX to offer Starlink’s broadband internet in India
content: This agreement, which is subject to SpaceX receiving its own authorizations to sell Starlink in India, would enable Jio and SpaceX to explore how Starlink can extend Jio’s offerings and how Jio can complement SpaceX’s direct offerings to consumers and businesses

title: Mysore man takes mother on pan-India pilgrimage on scooter; reaches Visakhapatnam
content: D. Krishna Kumar and his mother has covered 92,822 km as part of their pilgrimage titled ‘Matru Seva Sankalpa Yatra’ on a 2001 model Bajaj Chetak scooter

title: Two lakh tonnes of waste will be cleared from Vizag dumping yard, says SACL Chairman
content: Swachch Andhra programmes are being organised every third Saturday of the month in all Urban Local Bodies with different themes, says Pattabhi Ram

title: Will continue protests till internship stipend is increased, say NTR college veterinary students
content: BVSc students at NTR College of Veterinary Science protest for internship stipend hike, seeking support from government officials

title: GBA provision to appoint ward committee members draws citizens’ ire
content: Experts say Greater Bengaluru Authority’s power should not extend to ward committees as this could restrict the participation of eligible citizens

title: Delhi to get boat rides, MoU signed for development of Yamuna’s Sonia Vihar-Jagatpur stretch
content: Delhi Government and Centre sign MoU to develop water tourism on Yamuna, aiming to decongest city roads and boost travel options

title: Chief Minister tells SRM-University A.P. to lead the start-up ecosystem
content: Naidu calls upon the institution to develop a strong workforce of designers, coders and experts with skills in algorithms and hardware, which are vital for building a progressive state

title: ECI invites suggestions from political parties for resolving issues
content: Election Commission of India seeks input from political parties to address electoral issues by April 30, 2025

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool's Mohamed Salah open to Barcelona move
content: manchester city have placed Eduardo Camavinga on their list of options for the summer transfer window . the 22-year-old hasn't decided whether he wants to leave Los Blancos and has a contract that runs until 2029 . rumours have sounded out Barcelona over a potential move .

title: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar discharged from AIIMS after three days
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics.

title: 'Worth The Wait': T.J. and Dani Watt announce birth of first child, Blakely Marie
content: T.J. Watt  and his wife, Dani, announced the birth of their first child, Blakely Marie Watt, on Monday. The news was shared in a joint Instagram post on both parents' accounts, featuring six black-and-white photos of the baby girl. Watt's former  Pittsburgh Steelers  teammate  Russell Wilson  and  Las Vegas Raiders  defensive end  Maxx Crosby  were among those to offer well-wishes, as was Blakely Marie's uncle J.J. Watt. "Welcome to the world Blakely!!!!!" the older Watt commented. A post shared by Dani Watt (@danimariewatt) T.J. and Dani announced a child was on the way  in a post  last September. The pair were wed in September 2022.

title: NBA contenders don't fear the Thunder -- here are 22 reasons they should
content: "there's a certain seriousness that it takes to win in this league," says draymond green . "they haven't done it. And until a team does it, there's going to be a whole bunch of doubt," he says . doubters questioned whether Jayson Tatum and Jaylen Brown could win it .

title: Xabi Alonso's coaching career at a crossroads after UCL exit
content: Xabi Alonso has grown accustomed to being applauded by all sides of the bayArena . the bayer leverkusen coach was treated like a hero by the home supporters . he won the UEFA champions league last season without losing a single league game .

title: Why newly acquired QB Justin Fields will play position like no other in Jets history
content: the pendulum often swings in the opposite direction because it overcompensates for its perceived shortcomings . the theory applies to the Jets and their quarterback situation . fields has averaged 50.2 rushing yards per game in four seasons .
